### Steps to reproduce

I am experiencing issues with Read-Host when I am trying to read input from file

Let's see  you create a file read.pwsh having the following contents

$a = Read-Host;

and their is input file input.in having the following content
hello

After executing command on terminal 
pwsh read.pwsh < input.in

then I am getting the following output
hello
The above behaviour seems to be incorrect



### Expected behavior

```console
pwsh read.pwsh < input.in
```
this should not print anything


### Actual behavior

```console
pwsh read.pwsh < input.in
```
the input is getting printed


### Environment data

```powershell
OS Details        :  Ubuntu 16.04.4 LTS
Poweshell Version :  PowerShell 6.2.2
```


### Visuals

_No response_

iSazonov
comments.body:
Read-Host cmdlet is interactive cmdlet and the behavior is by-design. 

If you have a file you can use Get-Content cmdlet.
